reading_passages.title: About The Physical World
reading_passages.text: The physical world encompasses all of Earth's natural features and systems. It includes landforms like mountains, plains, and valleys, as well as water bodies such as oceans, rivers, and lakes. Climate patterns and weather systems are also part of the physical world, influencing ecosystems and biomes across the planet. Understanding the physical world helps us comprehend how natural systems function and how they impact human activities.

reading_passages.title: Earth's Systems
reading_passages.text: Earth's physical systems include the lithosphere (solid earth), hydrosphere (water), atmosphere (air), and biosphere (living things). These systems interact constantly, creating the dynamic environment we live in. The lithosphere includes the crust and upper mantle, forming continents and ocean basins. The hydrosphere encompasses all water on Earth, from oceans to groundwater. The atmosphere is the layer of gases surrounding Earth, protecting life and regulating temperature. The biosphere includes all living organisms and their habitats.

scientific_phenomena.title: The Physical World Climate
scientific_phenomena.description: Climate patterns on Earth are determined by factors including latitude, altitude, ocean currents, and prevailing winds. These patterns create distinct climate zones from the equator to the poles, affecting temperature, precipitation, and seasonal variations.
observation_prompts: What climate features can you identify in The Physical World?
How might climate affect people living in different regions of Earth?
What patterns do you notice about climate zones from the equator to the poles?

scientific_phenomena.title: The Physical World Landforms
scientific_phenomena.description: Earth's surface features include mountains, valleys, plains, plateaus, and basins. These landforms are created by tectonic forces, erosion, deposition, and other geological processes over millions of years.
observation_prompts: What landforms can you identify in The Physical World?
How might landforms affect human settlement patterns?
What patterns do you notice about how landforms are distributed across Earth?
